class.name: jsx3.net.Service
class.text: This class is used in conjunction with the XML Mapping Utility to provide transactional support for those services using XML-based messaging. Support includes those services defined via Schema, XML, XHTML, and WSDL (SOAP). In practice a developer would open General Interface Builder to access the XML Mapping Utility. They would then point the utility at a "pattern master" (i.e., WSDL, Schema, XML, etc) and begin using its visual tools to bind application objects to nodes in the XML messages to be sent and received. The output from the Mapping Utility is referred to as a mapping rule set. This rule set is an XML document based upon the Common Exchange Format (CXF) and defines the information necessary to support transactional data mapping. Many of the APIs available to the Service class allow the devloper to dynamically update various static values that were set using the XML Mapping Utility.

param.name: strRulesURL
param.text: The resolved URI for the rules document (a CXF document). Note: since this class is lazily loaded as of v3.2, the preferred method of instantiating this class is by calling the loadResource method on the context server (jsx3.app.Server) instance. This ensures proper URL resolution while also establishing the appropriate server context.

param.name: strOperationName
param.text: name of operation to call. This is only required if the rules file was generated via a WSDL.

param.name: strOutboundURL
param.text: address of a sample outbound message to use as opposed to the one generated by the tool

param.name: strInboundURL
param.text: when the project is run in static mode (as defined by the 'project deployment options' dialog), this document is used to simulate a typical server response

field.name: ON_INVALID
field.text:
Event type published each time a rule with one or more restrictions fails during message generation. The following named properties are available on the event object:
rule the rule node
message the message node
target this jsx3.net.Service instance
type the type of restriction that caused the invalidation event to be publsihed. For example, pattern.
value the value for the type. For example if type is pattern, then [A-Z]*

field.name: ON_PROCESS_RULE
field.text:
Event type published each time a mapping rule is used to create a node, locate a node, or map to a node.
target this jsx3.net.Service instance
rule the rule node being processed
action the action being performed by the rule. For example, Create Node, Map to Cache, Invalidate Node, etc.
description a description of the 'action'. For example, this.eval(setValue(2));
level the log level (e.g., 'severity' level) for the message. For example, 6 would signify a 'Trace' level event.

field.name: ON_TIMEOUT
field.text: Event type published when the response is still not ready after the specified timeout period.

field.name: json_namespace
field.text: XML namespace for JSON objects when converted to XML

method.name: compile
method.text: Compiles the CXF rules for this service instance to an equivalent XSLT document. This enables much faster performance than using the DOM-based iterator (default) to convert the XML response document into a CDF Document type. Note that this process only supports the map types CDF Document, CDF Record, and CDF Attribute. Only one CDF Document can be declared per Operation. Otherwise the compilation will fail. All other mapping types will be ignored and will not be converted into an XSLT equivalent. Also note that the order of a set of sibling mapping rules does not proscribe proper processing by way of sequence. This means that any order of sibling mapping rules will result in appropriate processing, regardless of the sibling node order returned from the given service. This facilitates nested record structures in that attributes can first be applied to a given record before child elements (e.g., a 'record') are added. Stated otherwise, any rule that has a descendant rule that would created a nested 'record' node should follow all sibling mapping rules that would create an 'attribute' entity. Call this method immediately before/after doCall for best performance.

method.name: doCall

param.name: bCancelIfInvalid
param.text: If true, the remote service will not be called if the message does not pass validation while being generated.

return.text: true if the message passed all validation rules while being generated.

method.text: Generates the request message (if applicable) and sends to the remote service.

method.name: doInboundMap
doRespond

param.name: objEvent
param.text: Event object with named property, target; or JSON object

method.text:
Provides a method to manually trigger the response chain by initiating the response event for the instance. One parameter can be passed to simulate the server response: objEvent. Based upon the properties contained by this object, the response will be handled differently by the response handler. The named properties are as follows:
target: A jsx3.net.Request instance or a JavaScript object that provides the methods, getResponseXML (to handle XML-formatted responses) or getResponseText (to handle JSON-formatted responses). If the event object does not expose the 'target' property and/or if the 'target' does not expose the methods getResponseText or getResponseXML, it is assumed that objEvent is a JSON object--the response itself.

method.name: getEndpointURL
method.text: Gets the URL for the service endpoint where the request will be sent

method.name: getInboundDocument
method.text: Call this method after the service has responded to get a parsed instance of the server's XML response

method.name: getInboundURL
method.text: Gets the URL for a "typical", XML-formatted server resonse document. This document is then used when the project is run in static mode (as defined by the Project Deployment Options).

method.name: getJSONP
method.text: If true, the Script transport will use JSONP

method.name: getMethod

return.text: GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, or SCRIPT

method.text: Gets the method for the request. Default is POST

method.name: getMode
method.text: Gets the mode (static jsx3.Boolean.FALSE or live jsx3.Boolean.TRUE).

method.name: getNamespace
method.text: Gets the namespace for the server/project to run the service instance within. If a namespace isn't provided, the system will look for the first application and use its namespace. If no applications exist, the namespace will be completely ignored.

method.name: getOperationName
method.text: Gets the name of the operation to use within a multi-operation rules file. Note: Rules created via a WSDL often have multiple named operations. Rules files generated without a WSDL contain no named operations, and instead use a single transaction.

method.name: getOutboundDocument
method.text: Call this method after 'doCall' has been called to get a parsed instance of the request document--what was actually sent to the remote service

method.name: getOutboundStubPath
method.text: Gets XPath address for the node in the outbound stub document to which to append the generated message.

method.name: getOutboundStubURL
method.text: Gets URL for the base stub to use for the request message (the XML document to contain the generated document)

method.name: getOutboundURL
method.text: Gets URL for a 'typical' XML-formatted request document to send to the server; when this is set, the mapper does not even attempt to generate a document. Instead, this document is sent directly to the server without any processing. Useful for testing requests that never change

method.name: getRequest
method.text: Gets the jsx3.net.HttpRequest instance that performs the transaction with the remote service (the transport object for the message).

method.name: getRulesURL
method.text: Gets the URL for the rules file to use (a CXF document). This rules file will be used by the Service instance to generate, send, receive and process XML messages

method.name: getRulesXML
method.text: Returns the rules document used by the Service instance (a CXF document)

method.name: getServer
method.text: Returns the server that this service runs in, as set by the setNamespace() method.

method.name: getServiceMessage

param.name: MESSAGETYPE
param.text: one of: input, output, or fault. If this value is provided, the server will generate test data for all nodes lacking a mapped or scripted value

param.name: strShellURL
param.text: relative URL to message shell to use as the starting container to put content into. Note that calling setOutboundStubURL or setOutboundStubDocument in conjunction with setOutboundStubPath are preferred to passing this parameter, since they provide much greater control. Also note that this value is stored statically in the rules document when the rules document is first created via the XML Mapping Utility.

method.text: Gets the request message specific to the MESSAGETYPE (input, output, fault). Typically only used for input (outbound) messages, but can be used for simulating a server response for output and fault (in the case of a SOAP transaction, fault) messages

method.name: getStatus
method.text: Gets the HTTP response code (i.e., 200, 404, 500, etc). This will be the response code provided by the bound jsx3.net.Request instance used for the transport. However, if setStatus has been called on the Service instance, the value supplied by the developer will be used instead.

method.name: getSupportedNamespaces
method.text: Returns a CR-LF delimited list of supported namespaces and thei related prefix (as defined by the Object, jsx3.net.Service._ns). Any nodes in a rules document (CXF) that implements one of the namespaces listed by this function, should implement the corresponding namespace prefix as also detailed here.

method.name: getUserName
method.text: Gets user name to send as part of the http request (for servers requiring http authentication)

method.name: getUserPass
method.text: Gets password to send as part of the http request (for servers requiring http authentication)

method.name: getWSDL
method.text: Gets the parsed WSDL (what was used as the original input to create the rules file being used by this service instance).
method.deprecated: The WSDL is no longer relevant to the Service class as the rules file will contain all information necessary to generate and process the Service interaction.

method.name: resetRules
method.text: Resets the rules tree to default state (with all 'skip' flags removed) from those rules that were skipped during the previous transaction

method.name: resetRulesTree
method.text: Dereferences the parsed rules tree (a jsx3.xml.Document instance) managed by this Service instance, forcing a reload of the document from disk the next time the rules document is requested

method.name: setEndpointURL
method.text: Sets the URL for the service endpoint where the request will be sent. Overrides the endpoint specified in the rules file.

method.name: setInboundDocument
method.text: Sets a parsed instance of the response document as soon as it returns from the server returned from the service; otherwise null

method.name: setInboundURL

param.name: strInboundURL
param.text: Alternate URL for the "typical" Service response. Note that this URL will be resolved relative to the context server. For example, if the project directory for the context server is 'test', then the following inputs (all of which are valid) are equivalent: jsxapp://test/xml/typical.xml, and xml/typical.xml, and JSXAPPS/test/xml/typical.xml

method.text: Sets the URL for a "typical", XML-formatted server resonse document. This document is then used when the project is run in static mode (as defined by the Project Settings dialog). Overrides the static setting in the rules file.

method.name: setJSONP
method.text: If set to true, the service class will append an additional parameter to the URL in the form, callback={method}, where {method} is a temporary callback function managed by the Service instance. This allows for flexibility when using JSON Services that are also available as JSONP Services, in that the same URL can be used (setEndpointURL) but different behaviors can be implemented. If the given JSONP Service uses a callback name different than "callback", pass the parameter name expected by the given JSON Service. You may also implement a callback of your own by directly modifying the endpoint URL to call the named function of your choosing. In such situations, pass false to this method, so the transport will not attempt any form of callback. If you do choose to implement your own callback handlers, you must manually conclude the service call with a call to doRespond.

method.name: setMethod

param.name: METHOD
param.text: GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, or SCRIPT

method.text: Sets the method for the request different than the one described in the rules file.

method.name: setMode
method.text: Sets the mode (static jsx3.Boolean.FALSE or live jsx3.Boolean.TRUE). Overrides the default setting for the context Server instance within which this Service instnace is running. (NOTE: This setting is accessible at the server level via the Project Settings dialog.) Setting this value to jsx3.Boolean.FALSE, forces a test document to be used to simulate a "typical" server response, instead of actually sending a request to a remote service. This is useful when setting up test environments as well as providing "live" interactions when the remote server may not be available.

method.name: setNamespace

param.name: namespace
param.text: the server (preferred) or the namespace of the server.

method.text: Sets the namespace for the server/project to run the service instance within.

method.name: setOnError

param.name: vntItem
param.text: either a script (as string) to execute via eval or a function that will be notified. Note: this function will receive a single parameter, a reference to this jsx3.net.Service instance

method.text: sets the script that will fire after the service has failed; if a soap fault envelope is returned, this will be processed as would any mapped tree. Allows for object repaints, cleanup, etc.
method.deprecated: Use jsx3.EventDispatcher interface instead with event type jsx3.net.Service.ON_ERROR.

method.name: setOnSuccess

param.name: vntItem
param.text: either a script (as string) to execute via eval or a function that will be notified when the service call completes. Note: this function will receive a single parameter, a reference to this jsx3.net.Service instance

method.text: Sets the script that will fire after the service has finished an inbound mapping or a function to callback to; allows for object repaints, cleanup, etc
method.deprecated: Use jsx3.EventDispatcher interface instead with event type jsx3.net.Service.ON_SUCCESS.

method.name: setOperationName

param.name: strOperationName
param.text: operation name

method.text: Sets the name of the operation to use within a multi-operation rules file. Note: Rules created via a WSDL often have multiple operations

method.name: setOutboundStubDocument
method.text: Sets the document that will serve as the container for the message generated by doCall and/or getServiceMessage. This is a useful way to dynamically assemble documents by chaining multiple service instances, using the output from one service as the input to another. For example, when a SOAP Envelope requires both a SOAP Header as well as a SOAP Body, this method allows the Envelope to be assembled via a two-step process of first adding mapped content to the Body, followed by a call to add mapped content to the Header. Note that this method takes precedence over the static stub document url referenced in the rules file as well as any call to setOutboundStubURL. Use this method in conjunction with setOutboundStubPath to point to the specific location in the document where the generated message should be appended.

method.name: setOutboundStubPath

param.name: strPath
param.text: Valid XSL path. For example, /SOAP-ENV:Envelope/SOAP-ENV:Body

method.text: Sets XPath address for the node in the outbound stub document to which to append the generated message. Overrides the static setting in the rules file.

method.name: setOutboundStubURL

param.name: strURL
param.text: URL for the document. Note that this URL will be resolved relative to the context server. For example, if the project directory for the context server is 'test', then the following inputs (all of which are valid) are equivalent: jsxapp://test/xml/typical.xml, and xml/typical.xml, and JSXAPPS/test/xml/typical.xml

method.text: Sets the URL to the document that will serve as the container for the message generated by doCall and/or getServiceMessage. Overrides the static setting stored in the rules file. Use this method in conjunction with setOutboundStubPath to point to the specific location in the document where the generated message should be appended.

method.name: setOutboundURL

param.name: strOutboundURL
param.text: Alternate URL for the static request to send. Note that this URL will be resolved relative to the context server. For example, if the project directory for the context server is 'test', then the following inputs (all of which are valid) are equivalent: jsxapp://test/xml/typical.xml, and xml/typical.xml, and JSXAPPS/test/xml/typical.xml

method.text: Sets the URL for a static XML-formatted request document to send to the Service. Note that when this is set, the mapper does not even attempt to generate a request document via the rules file. Instead, the static request document is sent directly to the remote Service without any processing. This is useful for requests that never change or as a means to test whether a Service is working, using a known, valid input.

method.name: setRequestHeader

param.name: strName
param.text: name for header parameter

param.name: strValue
param.text: value for the header parameter

method.text: Sets an HTTP Request header on the request. Set before calling, doCall()

method.name: setRulesURL
method.text: Sets the URL for the rules file to use (a CXF document). This rules file will be used by the Service instance to generate, send, receive and process XML messages

method.name: setStatus
method.text: Sets the HTTP response code (i.e., 200, 404, 500, etc). Typically, the Service instance determines this value by querying the bound request instance (jsx3.net.Request) returned by the method, [service_instance].getRequest(). However, calling this method will override normal operation by forcing a valid/invalid state that affects methdods relying on the HTTP status such as doInboundMap. This is particularly useful for SOAP services that provide alternate processing instructions and mappings when a Fault occurs as well as when running tests in Static mode.

method.name: setTimeout

param.name: intTimeout
param.text: number of milliseconds to wait befor publishing the ON_TIMEOUT event.

param.name: objHandler
param.text: if an object, the instance to notify of events (objFunction is required); if a string, the JSX id of the instance to notify of events (objFunction is required), must exist in the same Server; if a function, the function to call to notify of events (objFunction ignored)

param.name: objFunction
param.text: if objHandler is a string or object then the function to call on that instance. either a function or a string that is the name of a method of the instance

method.text: Specifies how long to wait for the service to respond before cancelling the call. Subscribes to the ON_TIMEOUT event

method.name: setTimeouts

param.name: intResolveTimeout
param.text: The value is applied to mapping host names (such as "www.microsoft.com") to IP addresses; the default value is infinite, meaning no timeout.

param.name: intConnectTimeout
param.text: The value is applied to establishing a communication socket with the target server, with a default timeout value of 60 seconds.

param.name: intSendTimeout
param.text: The value applies to sending an individual packet of request data (if any) on the communication socket to the target server. A large request sent to a server will normally be broken up into multiple packets; the send timeout applies to sending each packet individually. The default value is 5 minutes.

param.name: intReceiveTimeout
param.text: The value applies to receiving a packet of response data from the target server. Large responses will be broken up into multiple packets; the receive timeout applies to fetching each packet of data off the socket. The default value is 60 minutes.

method.text: Specifies timeout settings for resolving the domain name, establishing the connection to the server, sending the data, and receiving the response. The timeout parameters of the setTimeouts method are specified in milliseconds, so a value of 1000 would represent 1 second. A value of zero represents an infinite timeout. There are four separate timeout parameters: resolveTimeout, connectTimeout, sendTimeout, and receiveTimeout. When calling the setTimeouts method, all four values must be specified. The timeouts are applied at the Winsock layer.
method.deprecated: Due to browser security constraints, this method is no longer used. Use setTimeout instead. This method no longer affects any aspect of the Service call.

method.name: setUserName

param.name: strName
param.text: user name

method.text: Sets the user name to send with the posting (for those sites requiring http authentication)

method.name: setUserPass

param.name: strPass
param.text: password for user

method.text: Sets the password to send with the posting (for those sites requiring http authentication)

method.name: JSON2XML

param.name: objJ
param.text: Serialized JSON

throws.text: if objJ can not be evaluated as a valid JavaScript Object

method.text: Converts a JSON object to an XML document belonging to the namespace URI, http://xsd.tns.tibco.com/gi/json/2007/. This document can then be converted back to the same JSON format by calling the complimentary method, XML2JSON.

method.name: XML2JSON

return.text: serialized JSON Object or null if document did not belong to the correct namepace

method.text: Converts an XML document belonging to the namespace URI, http://xsd.tns.tibco.com/gi/json/2007/, into a serialized JSON String. This String, when evaluated, can then be converted back to the original document format by calling the complimentary method, JSON2XML.

method.name: getVersion
method.text: Gets the release/build for the class (i.e., "2.2.00") @ returns {String}
